The #BeHEARD Act *finally* writes the dignity of workers into the law and sends a simple, clear message: No matter your race, income, or job, you have a right to be safe at your job. 

#Timesup- And time for change.

The #BeHEARD will
‚óè prohibit mandatory arbitration & pre-dispute nondisclosure agreements
‚óè extend the statute of limitations for claims
‚óè eliminate the diff in the minimum wage btw tipped & hourly workers
‚óè require workplaces to create harassment prevention strategies

Last March, I stood in solidarity with Rosa, a subcontract worker at Logan Airport. Rosa experienced unspeakable assault. Her supervisor exposed himself to her, routinely touched her, and fired her in retaliation for reporting his behavior. 

No more.

Frankly, this bill was a long time coming, and way past due. From Hollywood to Congress, restaurants to farm fields, women and men in every type of workplace have seen harassment and discrimination ignored for too long.

Earlier this month, I joined with @PattyMurray to introduce the #BeHEARD Act- the first comprehensive bill to address workplace harassment. And, today, I was incredibly proud to join @RepPressley, activists, workers, and survivors to say #Timesup and time for justice. pic.twitter.com/kQya1UQHuX
